column4: Just let Ubuntu's installer create the partitions. It's smart enough to know that it needs to create an extended partition with logical partitions within it.
Please pastebin the output of "sudo parted -l".
do you have any suggestions/
Can you boot the Ubuntu LiveCD and run "sudo parted -l"?
i am in the manage pat.
Please boot a LiveCD/USB and pastebin the output of "sudo parted -l".
what is the code again?
sudo parted -l
Since I assume that you're running this from a Fedora LiveCD, run this: su -c "parted -l"
http://pastebin.com/MNVfmrMr
I thought that you had deleted one of the 4 partitions already. That does not appear to be true.
i did
it is saying that it is used for some reason i don't know why
the number 3 is free, so is the number 1
Parted is very rarely wrong. I think you're mistaken about what you've done.
what do you mean
someone suggest i delete the free partition the number 3 so i can use it in the installation, do this during the custom partition
You currently have 4 Primary partitions.
how do i get rid of 2 of them
If you're absolutely certain which ones are the correct ones to delete, use GParted. But *make sure everything you care about is backed up*.
gksu gparted from a terminal. It's a fairly intuitive GUI application.
says gksu is not a command
Ask in #fedora.
i figured it out, installing fedora! :)
